Class SoftResource<T extends @Nullable Object>

java.lang.Object
com.dua3.utility.io.SoftResource<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the resource type
public final class SoftResource<T extends @Nullable Object> extends Object
A lazily loaded and cached resource. Instances are created from a supplier that creates the resource on demand when get() is called and hold a SoftReference to it. When get() is called the next time, the same instance is returned if it has not yet been garbage collected. Otherwise, the supplier is called again.

    Class
    Description
    static final class 
    SoftResource.ResourceHolder<T extends @Nullable Object>
    Helper class to prevent the resource from being garbage collected.

  • Field Details

    • EMPTY_REFERENCE

      public static final SoftReference<?> EMPTY_REFERENCE
      A static final SoftReference holding a null reference. Represents an empty soft reference that can be reused to avoid unnecessary allocations of empty references. This is helpful in scenarios where a common empty reference is required or when representing the absence of a value.

    • EMPTY_RESOURCE

      public static final SoftResource<?> EMPTY_RESOURCE
      A constant representing an empty soft resource. This instance is created with a null supplier and serves as a predefined empty resource to avoid unnecessary instantiations of empty resources for generic use cases.

  • Method Details

    • of

      public static <T> SoftResource<T> of(Supplier<? extends T> supplier)
      Create a soft resource.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the resource
      Parameters:
      supplier - the resource supplier; the supplier should upon each invocation return equal instances
      Returns:
      soft resource

      public static <T extends @Nullable Object> SoftResource<T> emptyReference()
      Create an empty soft resource.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the resource
      Returns:
      empty soft resource

    • get

      public @Nullable T get()
      Get the resource.
      Returns:
      the resource; if it has not yet been set or has been garbage collected, it will be restored by invoking the supplier

    • isKnownToBeNull

      public boolean isKnownToBeNull()
      Check if it is already known that get() will return null for this soft resource.
      Returns:
      true, if this soft resource is known to be null

    • hold

      public SoftResource.ResourceHolder<T> hold()
      Get a strong reference holder for this resource to avoid thrashing. Intended for use in try-with-resources.
      Returns:
      ResourceHolder for this Resource
